text:
This consideration has been entirely from a personal point
of view, which seems to be the natural one under the circumstances.
It has led to the conclusion that I should go on record as hereby
applying for the job of manager of the NAEB Tape Network0 As
indicated earlier, I have great confidence in the possibilities
of this opportunity. It is not a job that I would want permanently
but it is one that I would be anxious to have for two or three
years. I would like to be around until it is a going concern.
There remain a couple of questions. I would like to know
more definitely what the salary is. My proposal for the summer
is as follows: That I be given a half-time appointment for the
summer. This will allow me to carry a heavier academic load for
the summer session. The time would be a bookkeeping device.
I am nore than willing to put in as much time as I possibly can.
A full time appointment would be in order as of September.
As to television. If the NAEB job materializes it would
still be possible, it seems to me, to be of some help with the
many problems of TV. Whether it would be by consultation,
helping to train crews, or whatever, I would be willing and
anxious to do everything possible. I could not of course give
it the time that would be possible on another basis, but I could
be of some help. While on the subject of television, and
thinking that perhaps the matter of pe sonnel would one day be
und<r consideration, I would like to offer the name of a likely
prospect. He is Dick Mall, currently an instructor in radio at
Ohio State. Dick was formerly head of the radio section at
Kansas State. He came to Ohio State to work on a PhD, which
he has completed except for his thesis. He has had considerable
experience in radio, both commercial and educational, and is
now working part time at â€™.LE-C, the Crosley TV station in
Coiambus. He is a capable man, and a very nice person in
addition.
This seems to complete ray part of the process. I now bow
out to await the ultimate decision.
